tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: She\'s not necessarily a bad teacher, just a loud and thoughtless. She gets louder if she thinks you aren\'t paying attention and says she doesn\'t believe in study guides, but never knows what\'s on her OWN TESTS. Also, she will give you a side eye if you come into class even 5 minutes late. She told my friend that next time she should not come at all

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great teacher (very intelligent) but a very challenging course difficult material and a lot of memorization.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I went into this class dreading it. I came out very interested. Dr. Marritt not only made this class interesting but she did everything to help us understand concepts as non-science majors. I would not say this class or her tests were easy, but she was very helpful and extremely generous with her time. She gave lots of opportunities to learn.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: It was literally the hardest class ever. She doesn\'t pronounce anything correctly. She is very confusing and hard to follow.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Dr. Marritt is one of those professors you just end up respecting because she is so knowledgeable and helpful towards the material and students. She tries to help you understand complicated processes with different examples and does so until the class gets it. The work was pretty straightforward you passed tests if you payed attention & studied.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great professor! Willing to help in any way she can. She wants her students to do well in her class. Great professor if you don\'t enjoy science, because she understands that some people don\'t love science.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great professor! Extremely willing to help in anyway possible. She wants her students to do well. Great professor if you don\'t like science, because she understands not everyone loves science.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Dr. Marritt does a very good job giving you all the material for exams. You must study the concepts in order to do well on her tests. Also, she is very good at helping her students so if you do not know what is going on, then ask!!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: This was the hardest class I\'ve taken at Meredith, but one of my favorites b/c of Dr. Marritt. She is so nice & is really concerned with how you are doing in the class. She teaches from the textbook & is straightforward. She is so helpful when you meet with her for office hours & will break down everything into baby steps to help you understand.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Dr.Marritt is one of my favorite professors at Meredith. She is so helpful and seems to really care that her students do well. I would definitely take her for biology if you are not interested in science

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: She is really sweet is not a hard grader. She gets her notes from the book, which is good because you can refer to your book and know what to expect on tests. She makes the class interesting and i would recommend her!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Her class was challenging, but fun. I did have to work hard, but I walked away actually understanding the material and enjoying the class. I highly recommend taking 105 with Marritt!
